pie-assistive-text.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-assistive-text
pie-assistive-text.description: PIE Design System Assistive Text built using Web Components

properties.name: variant
properties.description: What variant the assistive text should be such as default, error or success.

properties.name: isVisuallyHidden
properties.description: If true, hides the component visually but leaves it accessible for screen readers.

examples.basic:
<pie-assistive-text
    variant="${variant}"
    isVisuallyHidden>
    <!-- slot content -->
</pie-assistive-text>

pie-avatar.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-avatar
pie-avatar.description: PIE Design System Avatar built using Web Components

properties.name: tag
properties.description: What HTML element the avatar should be such as button, a  or div.

properties.name: label
properties.description: Label for the username that will be turned into initials inside the avatar, if provided.

properties.name: src
properties.description: The src attribute for the avatar image. When provided, displays an image instead of initials.

examples.basic: <pie-avatar label="${label}" tag="${tag}" src="${src}"></pie-avatar>

pie-breadcrumb.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-breadcrumb
pie-breadcrumb.description: PIE Design System Breadcrumb built using Web Components

properties.name: variant
properties.description: Optional variant for styling the breadcrumb component.

properties.name: isCompact
properties.description: Optional property for rendering a compact variation of the breadcrumb.

properties.name: hideCurrentPage
properties.description: Optional property to hide the current page of the breadcrumb (last item).

examples.basic:
<pie-breadcrumb
    variant="${variant}"
    isCompact
    hideCurrentPage>
        <!-- slot content -->
</pie-breadcrumb>

nuxt.code:
<template>
	<pie-breadcrumb>
		<pie-breadcrumb-item href="/">Home</pie-breadcrumb-item>
		<pie-breadcrumb-item href="#">Breadcrumb</pie-breadcrumb-item>
	</pie-breadcrumb>
</template>

<script setup lang="ts">
import { definePageMeta } from '#imports';
import '@justeattakeaway/pie-webc/components/breadcrumb.js';
import '@justeattakeaway/pie-webc/components/breadcrumb-item.js';

definePageMeta({
    title: 'Breadcrumb',
});
</script>

pie-button.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-button
pie-button.description: PIE design system button built using web components

properties.name: tag
properties.description: Which HTML element to use when rendering the button.

properties.name: size
properties.description: What size the button should be.

properties.name: type
properties.description: What type attribute should be applied to the button. For example submit, button.

properties.name: variant
properties.description: What style variant the button should be such as primary, outline or ghost.

properties.name: iconPlacement
properties.description: The placement of the icon slot, if provided, such as leading or trailing

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: When true, the button element is disabled.

properties.name: isLoading
properties.description: When true, displays a loading indicator inside the button.

properties.name: isFullWidth
properties.description: When true, the button element will occupy the full width of its container.

properties.name: isResponsive
properties.description: When true, enables the responsive size feature.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the button, submitted as a pair with the button's value as part of the form data, when that button is used to submit the form. [MDN reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/button#attributes)

properties.name: value
properties.description: Defines the value associated with the button's name when it's submitted with the form data. This value is passed to the server in params when the form is submitted using this button. [MDN reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/button#attributes)

properties.name: formaction
properties.description: The URL that processes the information submitted by the button. Overrides the action attribute of the button's form owner. Does nothing if there is no form owner. [MDN reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/button#attributes)

properties.name: formenctype
properties.description: If the button is a submit button (it's inside/associated with a <form> and doesn't have type="button"), specifies how to encode the form data that is submitted. If this attribute is specified, it overrides the enctype attribute of the button's form owner. [MDN reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/button#attributes)

properties.name: formmethod
properties.description: If the button is a submit button (it's inside/associated with a <form> and doesn't have type="button"), this attribute specifies the HTTP method used to submit the form. If specified, this attribute overrides the method attribute of the button's form owner. [MDN reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/button#attributes)

properties.name: formnovalidate
properties.description: If the button is a submit button, this Boolean attribute specifies that the form is not to be validated when it is submitted. If this attribute is specified, it overrides the novalidate attribute of the button's form owner. [MDN reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/button#attributes)

properties.name: formtarget
properties.description: If the button is a submit button, this attribute is an author-defined name or standardized, underscore-prefixed keyword indicating where to display the response from submitting the form. [MDN reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/button#attributes)

properties.name: responsiveSize
properties.description: What size should be attributed to the button when isResponsive is true and the screen is wide.

properties.name: href
properties.description: If the button is rendered as an anchor element, this attribute will be applied to the `href` attribute on the anchor. [MDN reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#href)

properties.name: rel
properties.description: If the button is rendered as an anchor element, this attribute will be applied to the `rel` attribute on the anchor. [MDN reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/rel)

properties.name: target
properties.description: If the button is rendered as an anchor element, this attribute will be applied to the `target` attribute on the anchor. [MDN reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#target)

properties.name: download
properties.description: If the button is rendered as an anchor element, this will set the download attribute on the anchor element. When an empty string, sets the download attribute without a value to trigger file downloads. When a non-empty string, sets the download attribute with the specified filename. [MDN reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#download)

examples.basic:
<pie-button
    tag="button"
    size="${size}"
    variant="${variant}"
    type="${type}"
    iconPlacement="${iconPlacement}"
    disabled
    isLoading
    isFullWidth
    isResponsive
    name=${name}
    value=${value}
    responsiveSize="${responsiveSize}"
    formaction=${formaction}
    formenctype=${formenctype}
    formmethod=${formmethod}
    formtarget=${formtarget}
    formnovalidate>
    <icon-plus-circle slot="icon"></icon-plus-circle>
    <!-- slot content -->
</pie-button>

patterns.name: Anchor
patterns.code:
<pie-button
    tag="a"
    size="${size}"
    variant="${variant}"
    iconPlacement="${iconPlacement}"
    isFullWidth
    isResponsive
    responsiveSize="${responsiveSize}"
    href="${href}"
    download="${download}"
    rel="${rel}"
    target="${target}">
    <icon-plus-circle slot="icon"></icon-plus-circle>
    <!-- slot content -->
</pie-button>

patterns.name: Form
patterns.code:
Fake form

Required fields are followed by *.

Contact information

Payment information

${Template({ ...props, variant: 'secondary', slot: 'Reset', type: 'reset', })} ${Template({ ...props, variant: 'primary', slot: 'Submit payment', type: 'submit', })}

pie-card.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-card
pie-card.description: PIE Design System Card built using Web Components

properties.name: tag
properties.description: What HTML element the card should be such as `a` or `button`.

properties.name: variant
properties.description: What style variant the card should be such as default or inverse.

properties.name: href
properties.description: The URL that the card should point to (this will not take effect unless the card is a link).

properties.name: target
properties.description: Where to display the linked URL such as _self, _blank, _parent or _top (this will not take effect unless the card is a link).

properties.name: rel
properties.description: What the relationship of the linked URL is (this will not take effect unless the card is a link).

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: When true, the card is disabled.

properties.name: aria
properties.description: The ARIA labels used for various parts of the card.

properties.name: isDraggable
properties.description: Allows the consumer to set draggable css styles (grab/grabbing cursor styles).

properties.name: padding
properties.description: Sets the padding of the card. Can be either a single value or two values separated by a comma. Setting a single value adds padding to all sides of the card, whereas setting two values will set the "paddingX, paddingY" padding. e.g `'a'` or `'a, b'`

examples.basic:
<pie-card
    tag="${tag}"
    variant="${variant}"
    href="${href || nothing}"
    target="${target || nothing}"
    rel="${rel || nothing}"
    disabled
    aria="${aria}"
    padding="${padding || nothing}"
    isDraggable
    @click="">
        <!-- slot content -->
    </pie-card>

pie-checkbox.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-checkbox
pie-checkbox.description: PIE Design System Checkbox built using Web Components

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value of the checkbox (used as a key/value pair in HTML forms with `name`).

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the checkbox (used as a key/value pair with `value`). This is required in order to work properly with forms.

properties.name: checked
properties.description: The checked state of the checkbox.

properties.name: defaultChecked
properties.description: The default checked state of the checkbox (not necessarily the same as the current checked state).

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Same as the HTML disabled attribute - indicates whether or not the checkbox is disabled.

properties.name: required
properties.description: If true, the checkbox must be checked for the form to be submittable.

properties.name: indeterminate
properties.description: Indicates whether the checkbox visually shows a horizontal line in the box instead of a check/tick. It has no impact on whether the checkbox's value is used in a form submission. That is decided by the checked state, regardless of the indeterminate state.

properties.name: assistiveText
properties.description: An optional assistive text to display below the input element. Must be provided when the status is success or error.

properties.name: status
properties.description: The status of the checkbox component / assistive text. Can be default, success or error.

properties.name: validity
properties.description:
(Read-only) returns a ValidityState with the validity states that this element is in.
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLObjectElement/validity

events.name: change
events.description: when checked state is changed.

methods.name: formDisabledCallback
formResetCallback
methods.description:
Called when the form that contains this component is reset.
If the current checked state is different to the default checked state,
the checked state is reset to the default checked state and a `change` event is emitted.

examples.basic:
<pie-checkbox
    value="${value}"
    name="${name}"
    checked
    defaultChecked
    disabled
    indeterminate
    required
    @change="handleEvent"
    assistiveText
    status=${status}>
    <!-- slot content -->
</pie-checkbox>

patterns.name: Example Form
patterns.code:
<form id="testForm">
    <pie-checkbox
        value="${value}"
        name
        checked
        defaultChecked
        disabled
        indeterminate
        required
        @change="handleEvent"
        assistiveText="${assistiveText}"
        status=${status}>
        <!-- slot content -->
    </pie-checkbox>
    <button type="reset">Reset</button>
    <button type="submit">Submit</button>
    <script>
        // var is used to prevent storybook from erroring when the script is re-run
        var form = document.querySelector('#testForm');

        form.addEventListener('submit', (e) => {
            e.preventDefault();

            // log out all form input values
            const formData = new FormData(form);
            console.log('All form elements:', form.elements);
            console.log('All form element data keys and values submitted:');

            for (const entry of formData.entries()) {
                console.table(entry);
            };
        });
    </script>
</form>

pie-checkbox-group.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-checkbox-group
pie-checkbox-group.description: PIE Design System Checkbox Group built using Web Components

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name associated with the group.

properties.name: assistiveText
properties.description: An optional assistive text to display below the checkbox group.

properties.name: isInline
properties.description: Inline (horizontal) positioning of checkbox items

properties.name: status
properties.description: The status of the checkbox component / assistive text. Can be default, success or error.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Same as the HTML disabled attribute - indicates whether or not the checkbox group is disabled.

events.name: pie-checkbox-group-disabled
events.description: triggered after the disabled state of the checkbox group changes.

events.name: pie-checkbox-group-error
events.description: triggered after the state of the checkbox group changes to error.

examples.basic:
Please note, the checkboxes are separate components. See pie-checkbox.

${labelSlot} checkbox 1 checkbox 2 checkbox 3 longer label checkbox 4 checkbox 5 even longer label: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. checkbox 6

nuxt.code:
<template>
  <pie-checkbox-group>
    <pie-form-label slot="label">Choose the way we can contact you:</pie-form-label>
    <pie-checkbox
        id="contactByEmail"
        @change="contactByEmail = $event.target.checked"
        :checked="contactByEmail">
      Contact By Email
    </pie-checkbox>
    <pie-checkbox
        id="contactByPhone"
        @change="contactByPhone = $event.target.checked"
        :checked="contactByPhone">
      Contact By Phone
    </pie-checkbox>
  </pie-checkbox-group>
</template>

<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref } from 'vue';
import { definePageMeta } from '#imports';
import '@justeattakeaway/pie-webc/components/checkbox.js';
import '@justeattakeaway/pie-webc/components/checkbox-group.js';
import '@justeattakeaway/pie-webc/components/form-label.js';

definePageMeta({
  title: 'Checkbox Group',
});

const contactByEmail = ref(false);
const contactByPhone = ref(false);

</script>

pie-chip.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-chip
pie-chip.description: PIE Design System Chip built using Web Components

properties.name: variant
properties.description: What style variant the chip should be such as default, outline or ghost.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Sets the functional type of the chip. Can be `button` or `checkbox`. Defaults to `button`.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: When true, the chip element is disabled.

properties.name: isSelected
properties.description: When true, the chip element will apply the selected styles.

properties.name: isLoading
properties.description: When true, displays a loading indicator inside the chip.

properties.name: isDismissible
properties.description: When true, displays a close icon to dismiss the chip component. Can be only used if `isSelected` is set to true

properties.name: aria
properties.description: The ARIA labels used for various parts of the chip.

events.name: close
events.description: when a user clicks the close button.

events.name: change
events.description: when a user interacts with the chip of type checkbox.

examples.basic:
<pie-chip
        aria="${aria}"
        disabled
        isSelected
        isLoading
        isDismissible
        variant="${variant}"
        type="${type}"
        @close="handleEvent"
        @change=
        @click=>
            <icon-heart-filled slot="icon"></icon-heart-filled>
            <!-- slot content -->
</pie-chip>

patterns.name: Checkbox Group
patterns.code:
Select your interests (multi-select)
Chip 1 Chip 2 Chip 3 (Disabled) Chip 4 (Disabled and Selected) Chip 5 Chip 6

patterns.name: Button Group
patterns.code:
This group uses a single event listener on the container to manage selection (single-select with toggle off).
Chip 1 Chip 2 Chip 3 (Disabled) Chip 4 Chip 5

pie-cookie-banner.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-cookie-banner
pie-cookie-banner.description: PIE Design System Cookie Banner built using Web Components

properties.name: hasPrimaryActionsOnly
properties.description: When true, sets the variant to "primary" for the button which accepts necessary cookies only.

properties.name: defaultPreferences
properties.description: Allows consumers to pass in specific preference(s) to the component which will toggle the switch to be on by default (if set to `true`).  e.g. { 'functional': true } or { 'functional': true, 'personalized': true, 'analytical': true }

properties.name: cookieStatementLink
properties.description: The URL of the cookie statement page the banner should link to.

properties.name: cookieTechnologiesLink
properties.description: The URL for the cookie technology link.

properties.name: country
properties.description: Assigns the country used for dynamically localising the component strings

properties.name: language
properties.description: Assigns the language used for dynamically localising the component strings

properties.name: openLinksInSameTab
properties.description: When true, external links (Cookie Statement, Cookie Technologies) will open in the same tab (`target="_self"`). When false (default), links open in a new browser tab (`target="_blank"`).

events.name: pie-cookie-banner-accept-all
events.description: when all cookies are accepted.

events.name: pie-cookie-banner-necessary-only
events.description: when all only necessary cookies are accepted.

events.name: pie-cookie-banner-manage-prefs
events.description: when a user clicks manage preferences.

events.name: pie-cookie-banner-prefs-saved
events.description: when a user clicks save preferences.

examples.basic:
<pie-cookie-banner
    country=${country}
    language=${language}

    hasPrimaryActionsOnly
    openLinksInSameTab="${openLinksInSameTab}"
    defaultPreferences="${defaultPreferences}"
    @pie-cookie-banner-necessary-only="handleEvent"
    @pie-cookie-banner-accept-all="handleEvent"
    @pie-cookie-banner-manage-prefs="handleEvent"
    @pie-cookie-banner-prefs-saved="handleEvent"></pie-cookie-banner>

patterns.name: Scrollable Page
patterns.code:
${BaseStoryTemplate(props)}
${createScrollablePageHTML()}

pie-data-table.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-data-table
pie-data-table.description: PIE Design System Data Table built using Web Components

properties.name: columns
properties.description: Array of column definitions

properties.name: data
properties.description: Array of data objects to display

examples.basic:
<pie-data-table
    columns="${columns}"
    data="${data}"
    data-test-id="pie-data-table"
></pie-data-table>

patterns.name: With Header
patterns.code:
<pie-data-table
    columns="${columns}"
    data="${data}"
    data-test-id="pie-data-table"
>
    ${headerSlot}
</pie-data-table>

patterns.name: With Strong Header
patterns.code:
<pie-data-table
    columns="${columns}"
    data="${data}"
    data-test-id="pie-data-table"
>
    ${headerStrongSlot}
</pie-data-table>

pie-divider.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-divider
pie-divider.description: PIE Design System Divider built using Web Components

properties.name: variant
properties.description: What style variant the divider should be such as default or inverse.

properties.name: orientation
properties.description: What orientation the divider should be such as horizontal or vertical.

properties.name: label
properties.description: The label text for the divider.

props.label: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Reprehenderit quas inventore quasi ullam, sed ab odio dicta, tempore

pie-form-label.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-form-label
pie-form-label.description: PIE Design System Form Label built using Web Components

properties.name: for
properties.description: The native for HTML attribute.

properties.name: optional
properties.description: Optional text to be placed next to the main label.

properties.name: trailing
properties.description: What the trailing text of the label component should be.

examples.basic:
<pie-form-label
    for="${props.for || nothing}"
    optional="${optional || nothing}"
    trailing="${trailing || nothing}">
    <!-- slot content -->
</pie-form-label>

pie-icon-button.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-icon-button
pie-icon-button.description: PIE Design System Icon Button built using Web Components

properties.name: aria
properties.description: The ARIA attributes available to use on the icon button. Offers label, labelledby, describedby, expanded and controls.

properties.name: size
properties.description: (Optional) What size the button should be.

properties.name: variant
properties.description: (Optional) What style variant the button should be such as primary, outline or ghost.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: (Optional) When true, the button element is disabled.

properties.name: isLoading
properties.description: (Optional) When true, a loading spinner is rendered.

examples.basic:
<pie-icon-button
    size="${size}"
    variant="${variant}"
    disabled
    isLoading
    aria="${aria}">
    <icon-close></icon-close>
</pie-icon-button>

pie-link.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-link
pie-link.description: PIE Design System Link built using Web Components

properties.name: tag
properties.description: What HTML element the link should be such as a or button.

properties.name: variant
properties.description: What style variant the link should be such as default, high-visibility or inverse.

properties.name: size
properties.description: What size the link should be.

properties.name: underline
properties.description: Defines what underline behavior the link should have, such as default or reversed. The `reversed` type can only be used if the link is a block element (isStandalone = true)

properties.name: iconPlacement
properties.description: The placement of the icon slot, if provided, such as leading or trailing. Will only apply if the link is a block element (isStandalone = true)

properties.name: href
properties.description: The URL that the hyperlink should point to

properties.name: target
properties.description: Where to display the linked URL such as _self, _blank, _parent or _top

properties.name: rel
properties.description: What the relationship of the linked URL is

properties.name: download
properties.description: Sets the download attribute to trigger file downloads. When an empty string, sets the download attribute without a value. When a non-empty string, sets the download attribute with the specified filename. Only available when `tag` is `a`. [MDN reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#download)

properties.name: isBold
properties.description: When true, the link text will be bold.

properties.name: isStandalone
properties.description: When true, the link will be treated as a block element

properties.name: hasVisited
properties.description: When true, the link will apply the styles for the visited state',

properties.name: type
properties.description: What type attribute should be applied if the tag is set to button. For example submit, button or menu.

properties.name: aria
properties.description: The ARIA labels used for the link.

examples.basic:
<pie-link
    aria="${aria}"
    tag="${tag}"
    variant="${variant}"
    size="${size}"
    underline="${underline}"
    iconPlacement="${iconPlacement}"
    href="${href}"
    target="${target}"
    download="${download}"
    rel="${rel}"
    type="${type}"
    isBold
    isStandalone
    hasVisited
>
    <icon-plus-circle slot="icon"></icon-plus-circle>
    <!-- slot content -->
</pie-link>

pie-list.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-list
pie-list.description: PIE Design System List built using Web Components

examples.basic: <pie-list></pie-list>

pie-lottie-player.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-lottie-player
pie-lottie-player.description: PIE Design System Lottie Player built using Web Components

methods.name: play
methods.description: Plays the animation from the beginning

examples.basic:
<pie-lottie-player
    animationSrc="${animationSrc === undefined ? animationSrcOptions[0] : animationSrc}"
    loopDisabled
    autoPlayDisabled
    speed="${speed}"
    direction="${direction}"
></pie-lottie-player>

pie-modal.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-modal
pie-modal.description: PIE design system modal built using web components

slots.description: Used to pass additional content to the modal header that scrolls with the heading and controls.
slots.name: headerContent

slots.description: Used to pass optional content to the modal component footer area.
slots.name: footer

slots.description: The default slot is used to pass content into the modal component.

properties.name: aria
properties.description: The ARIA labels used for the modal close and back buttons, as well as for the loading state.

properties.name: heading
properties.description: The text to display in the modal's heading.

properties.name: headingLevel
properties.description: The HTML heading tag to use for the modal's heading. Can be h1-h6.

properties.name: hasBackButton
properties.description: When true, the modal will have a back button.

properties.name: hasStackedActions
properties.description: When true, the actions will expand to full width and stack vertically. Only available below the mid breakpoint.

properties.name: isDismissible
properties.description: When set to `true`: 1. The close button within the modal will be visible. 2. The user can dismiss the modal via the ESCAPE key, clicking the backdrop or via a close button.  When set to `false`: 1. The close button within the modal will be hidden. 2. The user can NOT dismiss the modal via the ESCAPE key or clicking the backdrop.

properties.name: isHeadingEmphasised
properties.description: When true, displays the heading with emphasised style

properties.name: isFooterPinned
properties.description: When false, the modal footer will scroll with the content inside the modal body.

properties.name: isFullWidthBelowMid
properties.description: This controls whether a *medium-sized* modal will cover the full width of the page when below the mid breakpoint.

properties.name: isLoading
properties.description: When true, displays a loading spinner in the modal.

properties.name: isOpen
properties.description: When true, the modal will be open.

properties.name: leadingAction
properties.description: The leading action configuration for the modal.

properties.name: position
properties.description: The position of the modal; this controls where it will appear on the page.

properties.name: returnFocusAfterCloseSelector
properties.description: The selector for the element that you would like focus to be returned to when the modal is closed, e.g., #skipToMain

properties.name: size
properties.description: The size of the modal; this controls how wide it will appear on the page.

properties.name: supportingAction
properties.description: The supporting action configuration for the modal.

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.description: The background color for the modal.

properties.name: imageSlotMode
properties.description: The mode of the image slot; this controls whether the slot is treated as an image or an illustration.

properties.name: imageSlotAspectRatio
properties.description: The aspect ratio of the image slot; applies only when `imageSlotMode` is set to `image`.

events.name: pie-modal-open
events.description: when the modal is opened.

events.name: pie-modal-close
events.description: when the modal is closed.

events.name: pie-modal-back
events.description: when the modal back button is clicked.

events.name: pie-modal-leading-action-click
events.description: when the modal leading action is clicked.

events.name: pie-modal-supporting-action-click
events.description: when the modal supporting action is clicked.

examples.basic:
<pie-modal
    aria="${aria}"
    heading="${heading}"
    headingLevel="${headingLevel}"
    hasBackButton
    hasStackedActions
    isDismissible
    isHeadingEmphasised
    isFooterPinned
    isFullWidthBelowMid
    isLoading
    isOpen

    position="${position}"
    returnFocusAfterCloseSelector="${returnFocusAfterCloseSelector}"
    size="${size}"
    backgroundColor="${backgroundColor}"
    supportingAction="${supportingAction}"
    @pie-modal-close="handleEvent"
    @pie-modal-open="handleEvent"
    @pie-modal-back="handleEvent"
    @pie-modal-leading-action-click="handleEvent"
    @pie-modal-supporting-action-click="handleEvent">
        <!-- slot content -->
    </pie-modal>

props.slot: This content will appear after 5 seconds.

patterns.name: Form
patterns.code:
<pie-modal
    aria="${aria}"
    heading="${heading}"
    headingLevel="${headingLevel}"
    hasBackButton
    hasStackedActions
    isDismissible
    isHeadingEmphasised
    isFooterPinned
    isFullWidthBelowMid
    isLoading
    isOpen
    position="${position}"
    returnFocusAfterCloseSelector="${returnFocusAfterCloseSelector}"
    size="${size}"
    backgroundColor="${backgroundColor}"
    @pie-modal-close="handleEvent"
    @pie-modal-open="handleEvent"
    @pie-modal-back="handleEvent">
        <form id="testForm" style="display:flex; flex-direction:column;">
            <pie-form-label id="name-label" for="name">Name</pie-form-label>
            <pie-text-input aria-labelledby="name-label" autofocus id="name" name="name"></pie-text-input>

            <pie-form-label id="age-label" for="age">Age</pie-form-label>
            <pie-text-input aria-labelledby="age-label" id="age" name="age"></pie-text-input>

            <pie-button style="margin-top: var(--dt-spacing-d);">Submit</pie-button>
        </form>
    </pie-modal>

patterns.name: Scrollable Page
Focusable Elements Page
patterns.code:
${BaseStoryTemplate(props)}
${createFocusableElementsPageHTML()}

patterns.name: Slotted Image Content
Slotted Image Animation
patterns.code:
<pie-modal
    aria="${aria}"
    imageSlotMode="image"
    imageSlotAspectRatio="${imageSlotAspectRatio}"
    heading="${heading}"
    headingLevel="${headingLevel}"
    hasBackButton
    hasStackedActions
    isDismissible
    isHeadingEmphasised
    isFooterPinned
    isFullWidthBelowMid
    isLoading
    isOpen

    position="${position}"
    returnFocusAfterCloseSelector="${returnFocusAfterCloseSelector}"
    size="${size}"
    backgroundColor="${backgroundColor}"
    supportingAction="${supportingAction}"
    @pie-modal-close="handleEvent"
    @pie-modal-open="handleEvent"
    @pie-modal-back="handleEvent"
    @pie-modal-leading-action-click="handleEvent"
    @pie-modal-supporting-action-click="handleEvent">
        <pie-lottie-player slot="image" animationSrc="./static/animations/courier.json"></pie-lottie-player>
        <!-- slot content -->
    </pie-modal>

pie-notification.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-notification
pie-notification.description: PIE Design System Notification built using Web Components

properties.name: isOpen
properties.description: When true, the notification is set to be open and visible.

properties.name: variant
properties.description: Sets the variant of the notification.

properties.name: position
properties.description: Defines the proper styles, whether the component appears within the content or at the top of the interface

properties.name: isDismissible
properties.description: When true, allows dismissing the notification by clicking on the close button.

properties.name: isCompact
properties.description: When true, aligns the footer with the header and icons, making the component compact.

properties.name: heading
properties.description: The text to display in the notification's heading.

properties.name: headingLevel
properties.description: The HTML heading tag to use for the notification's heading. Can be h2-h6.

properties.name: hideIcon
properties.description: When true, the icon will be hidden.

properties.name: leadingAction
properties.description: The leading action for the notification.

properties.name: supportingAction
properties.description: The supporting action for the notification. Will only render if `leadingAction` is passed

properties.name: hasStackedActions
properties.description: When true, action buttons will stack on narrow screens. Not available when `isCompact` is true.

properties.name: aria
properties.description: The ARIA labels used for various parts of the notification. Only pass label if there is no heading to ensure the region is announced with a title

events.name: pie-notification-leading-action-click
events.description: When the notification leading action is clicked.

events.name: pie-notification-supporting-action-click
events.description: When the notification supporting action is clicked.

events.name: pie-notification-close
events.description: When the notification is closed.

events.name: pie-notification-open
events.description: When the notification is opened.

examples.basic:
<pie-notification
    aria="${aria}"
    isOpen
    variant="${variant}"
    position="${position}"
    isCompact
    isDismissible
    heading="${heading}"
    headingLevel="${headingLevel}"
    hideIcon
    leadingAction="${leadingAction}"
    supportingAction="${supportingAction}"
    hasStackedActions
    @pie-notification-leading-action-click="handleEvent"
    @pie-notification-supporting-action-click="handleEvent"
    @pie-notification-close="handleEvent"
    @pie-notification-open="handleEvent">
        ${iconSlot}
        <!-- slot content -->
</pie-notification>

props.heading: Update Available
props.slot: A new version is available with exciting features and improvements.

pie-radio.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-radio
pie-radio.description: PIE Design System Radio built using Web Components

properties.name: checked
properties.description: The checked state of the radio.

properties.name: defaultChecked
properties.description: The default checked state of the radio (not necessarily the same as the current checked state). Used when the radio is part of a form that is reset.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Same as the HTML disabled attribute - indicates whether or not the radio is disabled.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the radio (used as a key/value pair with `value`). This is required in order to work properly with forms.

properties.name: required
properties.description: Same as native required attribute. If any radio button in a same-named group of radio buttons has the required attribute, a radio button in that group must be checked, although it doesn't have to be the one with the attribute applied.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value of the radio (used as a key/value pair in HTML forms with `name`).

properties.name: status
properties.description: The status of the radio component. Can be default or error.

properties.name: validity
properties.description:
(Read-only) returns a ValidityState with the validity states that this element is in.
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLObjectElement/validity

events.name: input
events.description: Should fire whenever a user toggles the radio.

events.name: change
events.description: Fires when the radio is checked (but not when unchecked).

methods.name: formResetCallback
methods.description:
Called when the form that contains this component is reset.
If the current checked state is different to the default checked state,
the checked state is reset to the default checked state and a `change` event is emitted.

examples.basic:
<pie-radio
    checked
    disabled
    defaultChecked
    required
    name="${name}"
    value="${value}"
    status="${status}"
    @change="handleEvent">
    <!-- slot content -->
</pie-radio>

patterns.name: Example Form
patterns.code:
<style>
    pie-radio {
        display: block;
        margin-bottom: var(--dt-spacing-b);
    }
</style>
<form id="testForm">
    <pie-radio
        value="${value}"
        name="${name}"
        checked
        defaultChecked
        disabled
        required
        @change="handleEvent">
        <!-- slot content -->
    </pie-radio>
    <pie-button variant="secondary" type="reset">Reset</pie-button>
    <pie-button type="submit">Submit</pie-button>
    <script>
        // var is used to prevent storybook from erroring when the script is re-run
        var form = document.querySelector('#testForm');

        form.addEventListener('submit', (e) => {
            e.preventDefault();

            // log out all form input values
            const formData = new FormData(form);
            console.log('All form elements:', form.elements);
            console.log('All form element data keys and values submitted:');

            for (const entry of formData.entries()) {
                console.table(entry);
            };
        });
    </script>
</form>

pie-radio-group.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-radio-group
pie-radio-group.description: PIE Design System Radio Group built using Web Components

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name associated with the group.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value of the radio group (used as a key/value pair in HTML forms with `name`).

properties.name: isInline
properties.description: Inline (horizontal) positioning of radio items

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Same as the HTML disabled attribute - indicates whether or not the radio group is disabled.

properties.name: assistiveText
properties.description: An optional assistive text to display below the checkbox group.

properties.name: status
properties.description: The status of the radio group component / assistive text. Can be default, success or error.

events.name: change
events.description: when one of the radios state is changed.

examples.basic:
<pie-radio-group
        name="${name}"

        ?isInline=${isInline}
        ?disabled=${disabled}
        assistiveText="${assistiveText}"
        status=${status}
        @change="handleEvent">
            ${labelSlot}
            <pie-radio value="radio-one">radio 1</pie-radio>
            <pie-radio value="radio-two">radio 2</pie-radio>
            <pie-radio value="radio-three" disabled>radio 3 disabled</pie-radio>
            <pie-radio value="radio-four">radio 4</pie-radio>
            <pie-radio value="radio-five">radio 5 even longer label: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet,
            consectetur adipiscing elit.</pie-radio>
        <pie-radio value="radio-six">radio 6</pie-radio>
    </pie-radio-group>

pie-select.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-select
pie-select.description: PIE Design System Select built using Web Components

properties.name: size
properties.description: The size of the select component. Can be `small`, `medium` or `large`. Defaults to `medium`.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Same as the HTML disabled attribute - indicates whether the select is disabled.

properties.name: status
properties.description: The status of the select component / assistive text. Can be default or error.

properties.name: assistiveText
properties.description: An optional assistive text to display below the select element. Must be provided when the status is error.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the select (used as a key/value pair with `value`). This is required in order to work properly with forms.

properties.name: options
properties.description: The options to display in the select. Can be an array of option objects or option group objects.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value of the selected option

properties.name: validity
properties.description:
(Read-only) returns a ValidityState with the validity states that this element is in.
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLObjectElement/validity

events.name: change
events.description: when the selected option is changed.

methods.name: formDisabledCallback
formResetCallback
methods.description:
Called when the form that owns this component is reset.
Resets the value to the default select value.

examples.basic:
<pie-select
    id="${name}"
    name="${name}"
    disabled
    size="${size}"
    assistiveText="${assistiveText}"
    status="${status}"
    options="${options}"
    value="${value}"
    @change="handleEvent">
        <icon-placeholder slot="leadingIcon"></icon-placeholder>
</pie-select>

patterns.name: With Label
patterns.code:
Please note, the label is a separate component. See pie-form-label.

Label ${Template(props)}

nuxt.code:
<template>
    <pie-select :options="options"></pie-select>
</template>

<script setup lang="ts">
import { definePageMeta } from '#imports';
import '@justeattakeaway/pie-webc/components/select.js';

definePageMeta({
    title: 'Select',
});

const options = [
    {
        tag: 'optgroup',
        label: 'Animal',
        options: [
            {
                tag: 'option',
                text: 'Cat',
                value: 'cat',
            },
            {
                tag: 'option',
                text: 'Dog',
                value: 'dog',
            },
        ],
    },
];

</script>

pie-spinner.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-spinner
pie-spinner.description: PIE Design System Spinner built using Web Components

properties.name: aria
properties.description: The ARIA labels used for the spinner component.

properties.name: size
properties.description: What size the spinner should be.

properties.name: variant
properties.description: What style variant the spinner should be such as brand, secondary or inverse.

examples.basic:
<pie-spinner
    size="${size}"
    variant="${variant}"
    aria="${aria}">
</pie-spinner>

pie-switch.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-switch
pie-switch.description: PIE Design System Switch built using Web Components

properties.name: label
properties.description: The label value of the component

properties.name: labelPlacement
properties.description: The placement of the label such as leading or trailing

properties.name: aria
properties.description: The ARIA labels used for the switch.

properties.name: checked
properties.description: Same as the HTML checked attribute - indicates whether the switch is on or off

properties.name: required
properties.description: Same as the HTML required attribute - indicates whether the switch must be turned or not

properties.name: value
properties.description: Same as the HTML value attribute - indicates the value of the switch (for use with forms). Defaults to 'on'.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Same as the HTML name attribute - indicates the name of the switch (for use with forms)

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Same as the HTML disabled attribute - indicates whether the switch is disabled or not

properties.name: validity
properties.description:
(Read-only) returns a ValidityState with the validity states that this element is in.
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLObjectElement/validity

properties.name: validationMessage
properties.description:
(Read-only) Returns a string representing a localized message that describes the validation constraints that the control does not satisfy (if any).
This string is empty if the component is valid.
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLObjectElement/validationMessage

events.name: change
events.description: when the switch checked state is changed.

methods.name: checkValidity
methods.description:
Returns a boolean value which indicates validity of the value of the component. If the value is invalid, this method also fires the invalid event on the component.
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLInputElement/checkValidity

methods.name: reportValidity
methods.description:
If the value is invalid, this method also fires the invalid event on the element, and (if the event isn't canceled) reports the problem to the user.
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLInputElement/reportValidity

methods.name: setCustomValidity
methods.description:
Allows a consumer to set a custom validation message on the switch. An empty string counts as valid.
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLInputElement/setCustomValidity

examples.basic:
<pie-switch
    id="pie-switch"
    name="${name || nothing}"
    value="${value || nothing}"
    label="${label || nothing}"
    labelPlacement=""
    aria="${aria}"
    required
    checked
    disabled
    @change="handleEvent">
</pie-switch>

patterns.name: Form
patterns.code:
Example form with a single switch

A single switch inside a form.

${Template({ ...props, })}

Submit

patterns.name: Multi Switch Form
patterns.code:
Example form with multiple switches

Use the Tab key to navigate between the five switches below (one is disabled and should be skipped).

${Template({ ...props, label: 'Bacon', name: 'bacon', aria: {}, value: 'bacon_yes', checked: true, disabled: false, required: false, })} ${Template({ ...props, label: 'Lettuce', name: 'lettuce', aria: {}, value: 'lettuce_yes', checked: true, disabled: true, })} ${Template({ ...props, label: 'Tomato', name: 'tomato', aria: {}, value: 'tomato_yes', checked: false, disabled: false, })} ${Template({ ...props, label: 'Cheese', name: 'cheese', aria: {}, value: 'cheese_yes', checked: true, disabled: false, })} ${Template({ ...props, label: 'Onion', name: 'onion', aria: { label: 'a custom label for the onion switch', describedBy: 'a custom description for the onion switch', }, value: 'onion_yes', checked: false, disabled: false, })}

Submit

pie-tabs.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-tabs
pie-tabs.description: PIE Design System Tabs built using Web Components

examples.basic: <pie-tabs></pie-tabs>

pie-tag.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-tag
pie-tag.description: PIE Design System Tag built using Web Components

properties.name: variant
properties.description: What style variant the tag should be such as neutral/ghost etc.

properties.name: size
properties.description: What size the tag should be.

properties.name: isStrong
properties.description: When true, the "neutral", "information", "success", "error", "warning", "brand-03", "brand-04", "brand-05", "brand-06", and "brand-08" variants change their styles and become bolder

properties.name: isDimmed
properties.description: When true, applies a dimmed styling to the tag.

properties.name: isIconOnly
properties.description: Required to correctly render the tag when it contains only an icon.

properties.name: hasLeadingIcon
properties.description: Required to correctly render the tag when it has a leading icon plus text.

examples.basic: ${instructionalMessage}

patterns.name: Icon And Text
patterns.code:
Note: The isStrong property will change the colours of some variants.

${Template(args)}

patterns.name: Combined Custom
patterns.code:
We are using the CSS parts ::body and ::icon to customise the tag.

Please use with caution. Updates to the core component styles could override custom styles.

When using CSS parts we strongly recommend removing base styles by applying the css: all: initial to reduce risk of regression when core styles are updated.

Label 1 Label 2

patterns.name: Custom Tag Alternate
patterns.code:
We are using the CSS parts ::body and ::icon to customise the tag.

Please use with caution. Updates to the core component styles could override custom styles.

When using CSS parts we strongly recommend removing base styles by applying the css: all: initial to reduce risk of regression when core styles are updated.

Vegan

pie-text-input.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-text-input
pie-text-input.description: PIE Design System Input built using Web Components

slots.description: Short text to display at the start of the input. Wrap the text in a <span>. Do not use with leadingIcon at the same time.
slots.name: leadingText

slots.description: An icon to display at the start of the input. Do not use with leadingText at the same time.
slots.name: leadingIcon

slots.description: Short text to display at the end of the input. Wrap the text in a <span>. Do not use with trailingIcon at the same time.
slots.name: trailingText

slots.description: An icon to display at the end of the input. Do not use with trailingText at the same time.
slots.name: trailingIcon

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of HTML input to render.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value of the input (used as a key/value pair in HTML forms with `name`).

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the input (used as a key/value pair with `value`). This is required in order to work properly with forms.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Same as the HTML disabled attribute - indicates whether or not the input is disabled.

properties.name: pattern
properties.description: Specifies a regular expression the form control's value should match

properties.name: minlength
properties.description: Minimum length (number of characters) of value. Only applies to types: `text`, `url`, `tel`, `email`, and `password`.

properties.name: maxlength
properties.description: Maximum length (number of characters) of value. Only applies to types: `text`, `url`, `tel`, `email`, and `password`.

properties.name: autocomplete
properties.description: Allows the user to enable or disable autocomplete functionality on the input field. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete) for more information and values.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: The placeholder text to display when the input is empty. Only applies to types: `text`, `url`, `tel`, `email`, and `password`.

properties.name: autoFocus
properties.description: If true, the input will be focused on the first render. No more than one element in the document or dialog may have the autofocus attribute. If applied to multiple elements the first one will receive focus. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/autofocus) for more information.

properties.name: inputmode
properties.description: Provides a hint to browsers as to the type of virtual keyboard configuration to use when editing this element. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#inputmode) for more information.

properties.name: readonly
properties.description: When true, the user cannot edit the control. Not the same as disabled. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/readonly) for more information.

properties.name: defaultValue
properties.description: An optional default value to use when the input is reset.

properties.name: assistiveText
properties.description: An optional assistive text to display below the input element. Must be provided when the status is success or error.

properties.name: status
properties.description: The status of the input component / assistive text. Can be default, success or error.

properties.name: step
properties.description: An optional amount that value should be incremented or decremented by when using the up and down arrows in the input. Only applies when type is `number`.

properties.name: min
properties.description: The minimum value of the input. Only applies when type is `number`. If the value provided is lower, the input is invalid.

properties.name: max
properties.description: The maximum value of the input. Only applies when type is `number`. If the value provided is higher, the input is invalid.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The size of the input field. Can be `small`, `medium`, or `large`. Defaults to `medium`.

properties.name: required
properties.description: If true, the input is required to have a value before submitting the form. If there is no value, then the component validity state will be invalid.

properties.name: validity
properties.description:
(Read-only) returns a ValidityState with the validity states that this element is in.
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLObjectElement/validity

events.name: input
events.description: when the input value is changed.

events.name: change
events.description: when the input value is changed.

methods.name: formDisabledCallback
formResetCallback
methods.description:
Called when the form that owns this component is reset.
Resets the value to the default value.

examples.basic:
<pie-text-input
    type="${type}"
    value="${value}"
    name="${name}"
    id="${name}"
    disabled
    pattern="${pattern}"
    minlength="${minlength}"
    maxlength="${maxlength}"
    min="${min}"
    max="${max}"
    step="${step}"
    autocomplete="${autocomplete}"
    placeholder="${placeholder}"
    inputmode="${inputmode}"
    defaultValue="${defaultValue}"
    autoFocus
    readonly
    assistiveText="${assistiveText}"
    status=${status}
    size="${size}"
    required
    @input="handleEvent"
    @change="handleEvent">
        ${leadingSlot}
        ${trailingSlot}
</pie-text-input>

patterns.name: With Label
patterns.code:
Please note, the label is a separate component. See pie-form-label.

Label ${Template(props)}

patterns.code:
Username: Email: Website: Password: Favourite Number: Telephone:
Reset Submit

pie-textarea.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-textarea
pie-textarea.description: PIE Design System Textarea built using Web Components

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value of the textarea (used as a key/value pair in HTML forms with `name`).

properties.name: defaultValue
properties.description: An optional default value to use when the textarea is reset.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Same as the HTML disabled attribute - indicates whether the textarea is disabled.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The size of the textarea field. Can be `small`, `medium` or `large`. Defaults to `medium`.

properties.name: resize
properties.description: The resize mode of the textarea. Can be `auto` or `manual`. Defaults to `auto`. When set to `auto`, the textarea will resize vertically as needed. When set to `manual`, the textarea will not resize automatically but can be resized by the user.

properties.name: readonly
properties.description: When true, the user cannot edit the control. Not the same as disabled. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/readonly) for more information.

properties.name: autoFocus
properties.description: If true, the textarea will be focused on the first render. No more than one element in the document or dialog may have the autofocus attribute. If applied to multiple elements the first one will receive focus. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/autofocus) for more information.

properties.name: required
properties.description: If true, the textarea is required to have a value before submitting the form. If there is no value, then the component validity state will be invalid.

properties.name: status
properties.description: The status of the textarea component / assistive text. Can be default, success or error.

properties.name: assistiveText
properties.description: An optional assistive text to display below the textarea element. Must be provided when the status is success or error.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the textarea (used as a key/value pair with `value`). This is required in order to work properly with forms.

properties.name: autocomplete
properties.description: Allows the user to enable or disable autocomplete functionality on the textarea field. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete) for more information and values.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: The placeholder text to display when the textarea is empty.

properties.name: validity
properties.description:
(Read-only) returns a ValidityState with the validity states that this element is in.
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLObjectElement/validity

events.name: input
events.description: when the textarea value is changed.

events.name: change
events.description: when the textarea value is changed.

methods.name: formDisabledCallback
formResetCallback
methods.description:
Called when the form that owns this component is reset.
Resets the value to the default value.

examples.basic:
<pie-textarea
    id="${name}"
    name="${name}"
    value="${value}"
    defaultValue="${defaultValue}"
    disabled
    size="${size}"
    resize="${resize}"
    autocomplete="${autocomplete}"
    placeholder="${placeholder}"
    autoFocus
    readonly
    required
    @input="handleEvent"
    @change="handleEvent"
    assistiveText="${assistiveText}"
    status=${status}>
</pie-textarea>

patterns.name: Example Form
patterns.code:
Description:
Reset Submit

patterns.name: With Label
patterns.code:
Please note, the label is a separate component. See pie-form-label.

Label ${Template(props)}

pie-thumbnail.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-thumbnail
pie-thumbnail.description: PIE Design System Thumbnail built using Web Components

properties.name: variant
properties.description: What style variant the thumbnail should be such as default or outline.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Specify the size as a number between 24 and 128 (inclusive) and a multiple of 8.

properties.name: aspectRatio
properties.description: Sets the aspect-ratio of the thumbnail image.

properties.name: src
properties.description: The src attribute for the underlying image tag.

properties.name: alt
properties.description: The alt attribute for the underlying image tag.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: When true, the disabled styles are applied.

properties.name: hasPadding
properties.description: When true, extra spacing around the thumbnail container is applied.

properties.name: hideDefaultPlaceholder
properties.description: When true, hides the component default placeholder on image load failure.

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.description: What background color the thumbnail should be.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: Overrides the component default placeholder with a custom one on image load failure.

examples.basic:
<pie-thumbnail
    variant="${variant}"
    size="${size}"
    aspectRatio="${aspectRatio}"
    src="${src}"
    alt="${alt}"
    backgroundColor="${backgroundColor}"
    disabled
    hasPadding
    hideDefaultPlaceholder
    placeholder="${placeholder}"
</pie-thumbnail>

props.alt: Burger King meal with a cheeseburger, fries, onion rings, and Coca-Cola.
Chef assembling a burger in a kitchen.

pie-toast.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-toast
pie-toast.description: PIE Design System Toast built using Web Components

properties.name: message
properties.description: The message content of the toast.

properties.name: isOpen
properties.description: When true, the toast is set to be open and visible.

properties.name: variant
properties.description: Sets the variant of the toast.

properties.name: isStrong
properties.description: When true, the toast is displayed with a strong visual style.

properties.name: isDismissible
properties.description: When true, allows dismissing the toast by clicking on the close button.

properties.name: isMultiline
properties.description: Allows the message content to be displayed as multiline, limited to three rows.

properties.name: leadingAction
properties.description: The leading action for the toast.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Sets the duration of the toast in milliseconds before it auto-dismisses. If the value is null auto-dismiss is disabled If the value is not provided it auto-dismisses after 5 seconds

events.name: pie-toast-close
events.description: when a user clicks close button or when the toast auto dismiss.

events.name: pie-toast-open
events.description: when the toast is opened.

events.name: pie-toast-leading-action-click
events.description: when the user interacts with the leading action.

examples.basic:
<pie-toast
    isOpen
    isDismissible
    isStrong
    variant="${variant}"
    message="${message}"
    duration="${duration}"
    isMultiline
    leadingAction="${leadingAction}"
    @pie-toast-leading-action-click="handleEvent"
    @pie-toast-close="handleEvent"
    @pie-toast-open="handleEvent"/>
</pie-toast>

pie-toast-provider.name: @justeattakeaway/pie-toast-provider
pie-toast-provider.description: PIE Design System Toast Provider built using Web Components

properties.name: options
properties.description: Default options for all toasts; accepts all toast props.

properties.name: position
properties.description: Sets the position of the toast provider. When set to `default`, the toasts will be positioned at bottom-left for RTL languages and bottom-right for LTR languages.

events.name: pie-toast-provider-queue-update
events.description: when a toast is added or removed from the queue.

methods.name: createToast
methods.description: Adds a new toast to the queue and triggers its display if no toast is currently active.

methods.name: clearToasts
methods.description: Clears all toasts from the queue and dismisses the currently visible toast.

examples.basic:
<pie-toast-provider

    position=${position}
    style="${customZIndex ? `--toast-provider-z-index: ${customZIndex}` : ''}"
    @pie-toast-provider-queue-update="handleEvent">
</pie-toast-provider>
